summary: Implements a multi‑dimensional attention gate used in the decoder of an Attention U‑Net. It receives feature maps and a gating signal, computes attention coefficients via learned convolutions (theta, phi, psi) and a linear transformation (W), optionally subsamples and upsamples, and multiplies the coefficients with the input features to emphasize salient regions before they are merged in the decoder.
business_intent: Enhance the precision of image segmentation models—especially in medical imaging—by automatically focusing on the most relevant spatial features, thereby improving diagnostic accuracy and reducing computational waste.
